title: Periorbital and Orbital Cellulitis
author: Clinical Decision Support
keyPoints: Distinguish between preseptal (periorbital) and orbital cellulitis
Orbital cellulitis is a sight and life-threatening emergency
CT orbits is essential if orbital involvement suspected
Urgent IV antibiotics and surgical drainage may be required
redFlags: Reduced visual acuity or visual field defects

q1.text: Is there proptosis (forward displacement of the eye)?

q2.text: Are eye movements normal and full?

q4.text: Is there a relative afferent pupillary defect (RAPD)?

q5.text: What is the extent of eyelid swelling?

answers.text: Severe swelling, unable to open eye
Moderate swelling, can partially open eye

q7.text: What is the patient's age and any predisposing factors?

q8.text: Any history of recent sinusitis or upper respiratory infection?

q9.text: Any history of trauma or insect bite?

orbital_cellulitis.text: ORBITAL CELLULITIS - EMERGENCY: Urgent CT orbits, IV antibiotics (ceftriaxone + metronidazole). Urgent ophthalmology and ENT referral. May need surgical drainage. Monitor for intracranial complications.

severe_preseptal.text: SEVERE PRESEPTAL CELLULITIS: Consider CT orbits to exclude orbital involvement. IV antibiotics (co-amoxiclav or ceftriaxone). Urgent ophthalmology referral. May need admission.

high_risk_preseptal.text: HIGH-RISK PRESEPTAL CELLULITIS: Low threshold for CT orbits and IV antibiotics. Urgent ophthalmology referral. Consider admission for monitoring, especially in young children.

sinusitis_related.text: SINUSITIS-RELATED CELLULITIS: Treat underlying sinusitis. Oral antibiotics (co-amoxiclav) if mild, IV if severe. ENT referral if not improving. Watch for orbital spread.

trauma_related.text: TRAUMA-RELATED CELLULITIS: Clean wound thoroughly. Tetanus prophylaxis if needed. Oral antibiotics (flucloxacillin + metronidazole). Follow-up in 24-48 hours.

idiopathic_cellulitis.text: IDIOPATHIC PRESEPTAL CELLULITIS: Oral antibiotics (flucloxacillin or co-amoxiclav). Warm compresses. Follow-up in 24-48 hours. Advise return if worsening.
